alert.note: Alert for Clay; Kanawha; Northwest Fayette; Northwest Nicholas (West Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 18 at 1:20AM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern Nicholas, southeastern Kanawha, southwestern Clay and northwestern Fayette Counties through 145 AM EDT... At 120 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Pratt, or 17 miles northwest of Fayetteville, moving east at 40 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Fayetteville, Oak Hill, Montgomery, Ansted, Cedar Grove, East Bank, Glasgow, Smithers, Gauley Bridge, Pratt, Powellton, Glen, Hawks Nest State Park, Burnwell, Handley, Thurmond, Dawes, Muddlety, Swiss and Indore. This includes the following highways... West Virginia Turnpike between mile markers 67 and 86. Route 19 between mile markers 10 and 27, and between mile markers 46 and 49. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 200 AM EDT for central West Virginia.

area.areaDesc: Clay; Kanawha; Northwest Fayette; Northwest Nicholas
